[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/217.156.73.34|217.156.73.34]] ([[User talk:217.156.73.34|talk]]) to last version by Eskandarany
Mid-November to 6 January is more than 40 days
The privileges of Constantinople are not "secondary" to the privileges of Rome but are "equal" to the privileges of Rome. This is explicitly stated in Canon 28 of the Council of Chalcedon.
I deleted the word "over" because the bishop of Rome was never considered "over" the bishop of Constantinople, only "before" him. In Orthodox ecclesiology no bishop can be "over" any other.
Undo: purgatory is still Catholic doctrine, see Catechism 1030-1032
Promote external link to "See also" item.

/* Diaspora emigration to the West */ Changed to cultures from nationalities. Previous edit had removed Arabs claiming they're not nationality- so they are a culture at least
/* Mother of God (God-bearer) and saints */ This is the proper Orthodox terminology, is more parsimonious and needs reasons for changing.
/* Fasting */ Leave Paradise it's more parsimonious and previous edit anyhow gave no reason to change to Garden of Eden
/* Sacraments */ Looks like there is more disruptiveness on this Article. Fact that they are called Mysteries not Sacraments is highly significant and pertinent
